block.p: VISTEON CORP., -- Dearborn, Mich., the world's No. 3 auto-parts maker, said it would form a business group to expand sales of products that provide in-vehicle Internet access and other communications and entertainment services.
SALTON INC., -- Mount Prospect, Ill., a maker of kitchenware and home appliances, bought the trademarks of the closely held lamp maker Stiffel Co. for an undisclosed amount.

SUREBEAM CORP., -- San Diego, which manufactures electronic pasteurization systems and services for the food industry, filed to sell 6.7 million shares of Class A common stock at a price of $14.50 to $16.50 a share.

TOYOTA MOTOR CORP., -- the Japanese carmaker, said its Lexus luxury division had raised the United States price for the 2001-model GS midluxury sedan by $1,050, to $47,355. The price does not include a delivery charge of $545 a car.
